div.h2: NCH Primary Payer Code (if not Medicare)

div.p: The code, on an institutional claim, specifying a federal non-Medicare program or other source that has primary responsibility for the payment of the Medicare beneficiary's health insurance bills. The presence of a primary payer code indicates that some other payer besides Medicare covered at least some portion of the charges. Source: https://bluebutton.cms.gov/resources/variables/nchprmrypyr_cd
This code system /assets/ig/CodeSystem-nch-prmry-pyr-cd defines the following codes:

tr.td: Employer group health plan (EGHP) insurance for an aged beneficiary
Employer group health plan (EGHP) insurance for an aged beneficiary
EGHP insurance for an end-stage renal disease (ESRD) beneficiary
EGHP insurance for an end-stage renal disease (ESRD) beneficiary
Conditional payment by Medicare; future reimbursement from the Public Health Service (PHS) expected
Conditional payment by Medicare; future reimbursement from the Public Health Service (PHS) expected
Public Health Service (PHS) or other Federal agency (other than VA)
Public Health Service (PHS) or other Federal agency (other than VA)
Working disabled beneficiary under age 65 with a local government health plan (LGHP)
Working disabled beneficiary under age 65 with a local government health plan (LGHP)
Override EGHP - Medicare is primary payer
Override EGHP - Medicare is primary payer
Override non-EGHP - Medicare is primary payer Blank / missing = No other primary payer
Override non-EGHP - Medicare is primary payer Blank / missing = No other primary payer
